title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
jvelociter left at 01:13 (Quit: jvelociter  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 01:23  
florinciu left at 01:24 (Client Quit  
abusenius left at 01:59 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds  
bblfish left at 02:00 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
sdumitriu left at 02:12 (Ping timeout: 248 seconds  
bbc581 left at 04:58 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
mfong joined #xwiki at 06:41  
mfong - (06:41): hello!  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (06:42): Hi mfong  
mfong - (06:42): I'm testing out xwiki and ran into some problems - is anyone up for help me out?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (06:42): What's the problem?  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 06:43  
mfong - (06:44): I've installed the standalone windows package on Vista x64 - it looks like it's working, but I can't add or modify users into any groups.  The fields for "add users" aren't showing.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (06:44): Hmm. Firefox browser?  
mfong - (06:44): yes, but I've also tested on Chrome and IE7  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (06:45): Ok. What is the version of xwiki?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (06:45): Bottom of the page.  
mfong - (06:46): 2.3.1.29118  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (06:46): Ok. looking...  
mfong - (06:46): if i go to "edit -> inline form" the fields show, but it breaks other parts of the page and there's a bunch of syntax on the page too...  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (06:49): Hmm, don't see any changes (bug fixes) since then. Explain how you add users?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (06:50): Upper left corner -> XWiki -> Administor wiki -> users?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (06:50): Actually you would want to click the groups panel...  
mfong - (06:52): I actually don't have those options.  I'm logged in as the Admin user.  Top Left -> Xwiki -> Administer Wiki -> Groups -> XwikiAdminGroup  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (06:52): So you click on the Link that says XWikiAdminGroup?  
mfong - (06:52): Yup  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (06:53): Ahh, try clicking the pencel icon instead.  
mfong - (06:54): ah,  thanks.   I thought I did that for some reason...  
bbc581 joined #xwiki at 06:54  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (06:55): I just tried what you had done, that ought to work as well.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (06:56): Click XWikiAdminGroup then click edit... I see a page where I can add users.  
mfong - (06:59): I tried that, but I see "Member" with a text field below, and the macro that says, "The environment prevents the table to load data."  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (07:00): Hmm. That is not good. Usually that means javascript is turned off but that can't be your case.  
mfong - (07:00): hrm, i just updated it to update 20..for java x64  should that be ok?  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 07:01  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (07:01): Java x64 should have no effect.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (07:02): You see: "Add user to group:\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ [Add]"  ?  
Denis1 left at 07:02 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
mfong - (07:04): after clicking "edit"?  no - it brings me to the wsiwyg editor.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (07:04): I see. If you edit the url to say /inline/ instead of /edit/ does it fix the problem?  
mfong - (07:05): I can see the fields - but the ADD buttons don't work anymore, and I have java text on the page:  
mfong - (07:05): <script type="text/javascript"> // <![CDATA[ window.addNewMember = function(uorg, name) { //url = adduorg if(name) { var url = "/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiAdminGroup" + "?xpage=adduorg" + "&" + "uorg=" + uorg + "&" + "name=" + name; new Ajax.Request(url, { method: 'get', onSuccess: function(transport) { $('userSuggest').value = ""; $('groupSuggest').value = ""; var nr = parseInt(transport.responseText); if(nr == 0) $('errMsg').innerHTML  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (07:07): Hmm. I have just tested it on the trunk and it seems to be fixed.  
Denis joined #xwiki at 07:08  
mfong - (07:11): should I reinstall or check a setting somewhere?  
vmassol1 joined #xwiki at 07:14  
vmassol left at 07:16 (Ping timeout: 248 seconds  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (07:16): Starting 2.3 to see if I can reproduce...  
mfong - (07:20): thanks.  
vmassol1 left at 07:20 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (07:23): Works in XWiki Enterprise 2.3.28602  
mfong - (07:28): ok.  well, i'll do some more testing.   I'll try installing to a linux sever next.   thanks for your time Caleb.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (07:29): No problem. You might try installing 2.4M1. I think that problem has since been sorted out.  
mfong - (07:30): sounds good.  I like the look and feel of xwiki.  The wsiwyg is the best one I've found so far in a wiki.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (07:32): Cool :)  I just noticed there was a change in your timeframe, you might be able to fix simply by upgrading (or downgrading) the xar file.

KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 09:55  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 10:12  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 10:14  
arkub joined #xwiki at 10:18  
sburjan - (10:19): hello.  
sburjan - (10:22): If I use Toucan, and I'd like to use another color theme, I get an some HTML macro error. (i'll create an issue for that)  
sburjan - (10:22): my question is : if these color themes are incompatible/do not work with toucan, shouldn't there be a warning when trying to set one using toucan ?  
sburjan - (10:23): or even better, not to apprea in the color theme dropdown ? (I guess this is a littlebit harder to achieve)  
sburjan - (10:23): \*appear  
evalica - (10:24): Toucan is less influenced by ColorThemes than Colibri - you see the colors set, just on the components that implements the CT, no matter of the skin used  
evalica - (10:26): I don't get any HTML macro error - so before you make an issue - be sure on what version of XE you are testing  
evalica - (10:26): and what changes you done to it  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:28  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 10:34  
fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 10:35  
sburjan - (10:36): using 2.4 M1  
sburjan - (10:40): it works if you change it from the Administration->Presentation  
sburjan - (10:40): iI get HTML macro error If I cant to change the theme from the Color Themes space  
sburjan - (10:40): \*want  
sburjan - (10:41): evalica : can you confirm ?  
silviar - (10:41): Here's the error http://pastebin.com/wzWmCX8d  
evalica - (10:41): I tested too on 2.4-milestone-1: changed the skin to toucan - changed the colortheme - no problem  
jvdrean1 joined #xwiki at 10:42  
jvdrean left at 10:42 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
evalica - (10:42): this is a rendering error, not a colortheme one  
sburjan - (10:43): evalica : and did the color theme changed on toucan ?  
evalica - (10:43): yes  
silviar - (10:43): note that the different theme is set; it doesn't affect the showing up of the new theme  
evalica - (10:43): you can observer this by looking at the table header color... or at links on hover state, etc  
silviar - (10:49): to reproduce the above error go to the "Color Themes" space, click "use this theme" for any theme; under the "info" macro you will see the error  
silviar - (10:49): sburjan is filling a bug for it

CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:33): Why do we have an id macro if we can just use 2.0 syntax (%id="some-id"%)?
